#Text=Wikinews interviews Chinese-American martial artist Alfred Hsing
#Text=Tuesday , August 16 , 2011
#Text=Alfred Hsing

#Text=Alfred Hsing , a US martial artist with Chinese origins , besides having a long history of martial arts training in various styles , such as traditional kung fu , tae kwon do and karate , considers wushu – an athletic sport based on Chinese martial arts – as a form of art that pushes one 's physical limits and stimulates the mind at the same time .

#Text=After having won the gold medal at the 10th World Wushu Championships , he became international movie star Jet Li 's personal assistant and went on to do stunts , action choreography , and land roles in movies .
#Text=Hungarian Wikinews contributor Teemeah has interviewed Alfred Hsing about his views on martial arts , life and Wikipedia .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Teemeah Why did you start practicing wushu ? Is it a way of retaining your origins ?
#Text=A. Hsing When I was young my father brought home a lot of Chinese martial arts movies so my brother and I grew up liking martial arts .
#Text=For a long time we would practice moves at home and play fight each other .

#Text=There are a lot of styles of martial arts and I took classes in tae kwon do , karate , and some traditional kung fu , but when I discovered my first wushu class I knew it was exactly what I was looking for .

#Text=I think at first I wanted to learn wushu because I enjoyed it , but as my training became more advanced and serious I realized that it led me back to my roots and I learned much more about my own culture because of it .
#Text=Teemeah
#Text=What does wushu mean to you personally ?
#Text=A. Hsing Wushu comes second nature to me and through the repetition of practice it 's like a form of meditation for me .
#Text=When I practice I can release all of the stresses brought on by the world .
#Text=Teemeah
#Text=Do you have an idol or role model in martial arts ?
#Text=A. Hsing When I grew up my dad rented a lot of Jet Li and Jackie Chan movies .
#Text=As I got to learn more about how hard working and dedicated they were , they became more of an inspiration to me and motivated me to challenge myself to my limits .
#Text=Teemeah Now you live in China . Do you consider to stay there or would you move back to the US if you had the opportunity to ?

#Text=A. Hsing I am living in China right now , but I do n't usually limit myself by setting strict plans for the future because we never know what the future will hold so I usually stay open minded and keep myself open to whatever opportunities come my way .
#Text=Of course since I have family in the US I do see myself being back there at some point , but Asia also is like home for me .
#Text=Teemeah
#Text=How do you find living in China ?
#Text=What is your favourite pastime there ?
#Text=A. Hsing China is a very exciting place right now because there are so many opportunities and there is so much growth .
#Text=Most of my time is spent working , but when I 'm not working my favorite pastime is probably working out with friends .
#Text=I enjoy anything with physical activity like swimming , playing ball , sparring , etc.
#Text=Teemeah
#Text=Can you tell us what you have been doing lately ?
#Text=A. Hsing I 've been increasing my scope of knowledge lately .
#Text=Aside from wushu , I 've been training boxing , muay thai , and tai chi .
#Text=I hope to keep expanding my knowledge and skill so that I can be versatile and well rounded in martial arts .
#Text=Teemeah You have accomplished great results in competitive martial arts but an individual always needs a goal in life . What is yours now ?
#Text=A. Hsing I have many goals right now .
#Text=I think one of the biggest ones is simply maintaining balance in life .
#Text=Another goal is to keep on improving myself .
#Text=Right now I am also doing more acting and action choreography and following my passions .
#Text=Teemeah You seem to travel a lot , have you ever visited Hungary ?
#Text=A. Hsing I have been around Asia and Europe , but have not had a chance to visit Hungary yet .
#Text=Maybe you could show me around sometime .
#Text=Teemeah And now a different topic : what is your opinion about Wikipedia , as a project [ that ] aims to collect the knowledge of mankind ?
#Text=A. Hsing I think Wikipedia has been very useful .
#Text=The ability to aggregate data onto a single search-able platform is definitely a great contribution .
#Text=Mankind has [ always ] been able to improve through building on knowledge from the past and now Wikipedia is making this process more efficient .
#Text=Teemeah
#Text=Do you use it ?
#Text=Have you ever contributed yourself ?
#Text=A. Hsing I do use it when I need to quickly find out information on a certain subject .
#Text=I have made some small contributions on Wikipedia in regards to wushu .
